participant_1.background:
I am a software engineer who prides myself on finding the best tools for the job, even if they're not the most popular.
I made my mom a dress for her birthday and she loved it!
i sometimes scratch my nose for fun.
I try to go for a walk at least three times a week, but it's hard to find the motivation when I'm feeling down.
i love to read.

participant_2.background:
I go to the desert a lot, but I'm not as happy with my weight as I could be.
my favorite show is csi.
i have survived near death experiences.
I'm proud of my daughter and mom!
my favorite color is orange.

content.text: Hello!
Hi there!
What's your favorite color?
Mine's orange, how about you?
Mine's either blue or green, but I do like orange too.
Oh nice! I love going to the desert, have you ever been?
No, I haven't actually! Is it nice?
It can be, depending on the time of year. But the views are amazing!
Oh wow, I'll have to add that to my list of places to visit.
You should! It's great to get away from the city and just relax in nature.
That's what I love about reading, it's like a vacation for my mind.
I love reading too! It's the best way to escape reality.
What's your favorite book?
That's a tough one, I have so many favorites! But I'd have to say either "The Great Gatsby" or "The Catcher in the Rye".
I love both of those books! "The Great Gatsby" is one of my favorites too.
It's so well written, and the characters are so complex.
Exactly! It's a classic for a reason.
Yeah, it's definitely one of those books that you can read over and over again and still find new things to appreciate.
I agree! So, what do you do for a living?
I'm a stay-at-home mom, but I used to be a nurse.
Oh wow, that must be a lot of work!
It can be, but it's also really rewarding.
I bet! What's your favorite thing about being a stay-at-home mom?
Spending time with my daughter, and getting to be a part of all of her milestones.
That's so sweet! I'm sure she loves having you as a mom.
I hope so! She's my best friend.
Aw, that's so nice. I'm sure she'll remember that when she's older.
I hope so
